title: Command-line Arguments
description: Command-line arguments are passed to the program through the main function. The standard signature is 'frame main(argc: int, argv: string*) ret int' where argc is the argument count (including program name) and argv is an array of argument strings. argv[0] is always the program name, argv[1] is the first user argument. Always check argc before accessing argv elements to prevent out-of-bounds access. Arguments are strings - use conversion functions (atoi, atof) to parse numbers. This example shows argument parsing, validation, and conversion to different types.
